tweets.text: (Thread) #HeritageTreasures day isn't just about historic houses and buildings - @HeritageFundUK @HeritageFundM_E funding supports natural heritage too and helped bring to life the joint Bedford River Valley Park project w/ @BedfordTweets, @EnvAgency, @mhclg and @NaturalEngland https://t.co/AyEFq37QlR

And a big thank you to our fantastic partners, Forest team and volunteers for the brilliant work they do keeping Bedford River Valley Park – our very own #HeritageTreasure - looked after
@BedfordTweets @EnvAgency @mhclg @naturalengland @HeritageFundUK @HeritageFundM_E

If you’re local and able to visit the Grange Estate for your exercise during lockdown on #HeritageTreasures day then please let us know what the site means to you, and if not then definitely bookmark the webpage for a great day out another time #Bedford #Bedfordshire

tweets.text:
In a joint message, @TonyJuniper from @NaturalEngland,
@EmmaHowardBoyd from @EnvAgency and @williamrworsley from @ForestryEngland have declared that this must be the year we ramp up action on climate change and #NatureRecovery.

#TogetherForOurPlanet
https://t.co/imv3CfNn6I

tweets.text:
So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent £1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p

@tommustill @WestReservoir @WildWoodberry @LDNWaterkeeper For future information please immediately call the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE Incident hotline: 0800 80 70 60 Appalling that this has not been dealt with. #SaveOurRivers #StateOfNature #SDG6 #SDG14

We have ceased additional pumping now that all water has been removed from Currymoor. Normal pumping routine has re-established but the extra pumps will remain in place for the mean time should they be needed. https://t.co/HyM8eV7Bv9

urls.title: Prime Minister commits £3bn UK climate finance to supporting nature
urls.description: UK will spend at least £3bn of international climate finance on nature and biodiversity over five years.

tweets.text:
UK commits £3 billion on climate solutions that protect and restore nature and biodiversity.

"We will not achieve our goals on climate change, sustainable development or preventing pandemics if we fail to take care of the natural world"

#OnePlanetSummit
https://t.co/qbptHZUn85

🌳 The Green Futures programme will get you bang up-to-date with the latest environmental and water rules for your farm

💻 Webinars on Feb 2⃣ & 9⃣

🗨️ Experts from @NFUtweets @CLAtweets @EnvAgency @DefraFAS @AnglianWater @stwater 

 🎟️ Booking: https://t.co/gXUZIO7mFL https://t.co/ag0oEekGRw

@MerryAlbright @iamjennie58 @bettwsresident @EnvAgencyMids @HelenStace_HWT Only small amounts. Main problem is all the carbohydrates in it. This creates a massive Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD) due to the bacterial composition of the effluent. Leading in turn to depleted O levels and fish, etc death. It can have a BOD 200 times that of untreated sewage!

Bank clearance work by our @GroundControlGC team for the @EnvAgency clearing a blocked access path, on completion this will allow tractor vehicles to maintain the banking and encourage grass growth on the bank top. https://t.co/OEVfllNjEn

Quagga mussels are an invasive non-native species and have recently been found in the #RiverTrent.

They can spread rapidly and block pipes.

Help us prevent this: check, clean and dry your equipment and footwear after spending time around watercourses. 
https://t.co/yvjXsvp14v https://t.co/xuYv9GXUrF

tweets.text: Morning @Bankfieldbecky and @jaynesvoice - colleagues are looking for urban resilience / responsive planning good practice at local level in UK. Are specifically interested in extreme events - in UK I suspect this means flooding.  Can you recommend any areas?

At the weekend we were out checking fishing licences🎣

We checked 19 anglers at Highwoods Country Park in Colchester and they all had valid licences😀

Buy yours here: https://t.co/EL8RJbio0s #Fishing #Essex https://t.co/fJAZAThQeB

urls.title: Community engagement on Tenbury Wells flood risk management scheme
urls.description: People in Tenbury Wells have until 31 January 2021 to visit a virtual engagement room to find out about a proposed flood risk management scheme.

tweets.text:
Reminder to residents & business owners in #TenburyWells - visit our online engagement room before the end of Jan & find out about your flood risk management scheme

Two facilitated phone calls arranged for 26 & 28 January for those without internet access https://t.co/GY8WvQgmob

@BillBullick @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I am not sure that is actually the problem. I suspect that all resources are focussed on flood prevention, which is important, but not the sole remit of the agency.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I’m genuinely confused. We are told repeatedly about spending cuts. Yet this shows they have increased from £1.2bn to £1.4bn over 5 years?

River wharfe at wetherby. Could be wrong but i am certain this is not exceptional circumstances as more sewage flows in to the river above the barbel spawning grounds. @CleanIlkley @rivercide_live #pollution #environment #wipes #saveourrivers https://t.co/dZZ8zFWGDe
